column1: Art Institute of Chicago////This museum is huge. It is the first time I felt relieved instead of cheated upon seeing closed wings. Having no time limit and a slight compulsion to finish whatever I start
column2: I was exhausted at the end.  Among the permanent collection
column3: the Monet Haystacks made me fall in love with impressionism again. On my visit the special exhibitions included Impressionism
column5: and Modernity; Undressed: The Fashion of Privacy; and Zarina: Paper Like Skin.  My impression of the modern art wing: piles of crap on the floor. At the same time
column6: I loved Zarina. One of her works were approximately 20 sheets of paper
column7: each pricked by pins numerous times. May you love this museum as well. Enjoy.
